results.title: Intellectually disabled offenders and victims (Kit)
results.brief_description: This educational kit is a collaborative effort by Victoria Police, the Office of public advocacy and Community Services Victoria. It is aimed primarily at police officers who are unaware of intellectual disability and how to treat offenders who are afflicted with this disability. It contains a video, teachers notes and overhead slides suitable for a group presentation. The video presents a number of scenarios involving intellectualy disabled people and potential outcomes.

results.title: Intellectual growth and achievement
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: enhancing social and cognitive growth in children.”.
Parents and teachers are ambitious for their children to become good students. Questions about how to develop intellectual growth and achievement have been the focus of many psychological studies. Examines myths such as predicting later ability on early achievement in childhood and the importance of hands on activity as opposed to observation. Factors determining IQ, using twins and adoptees raise interesting questions regarding the nature versus nurture debate, as well as looking at factors during pregnancy which may affect intellectual development.

results.title: Integrated curriculum
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Chris O'Rourke, Lily Steiner and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Shows how an integrated curriculum can operate in classrooms with children ranging from preparatory to years five and six. It shows how different areas of the curriculum can be integrated to promote learning.

results.title: Integrated Alternative Health Care
results.brief_description: We are shown the full range of medical and educational programs with their new approach to integrated care, which has also been called alternative medicine. The film focuses on the role of paramedics and on their education and their motivation.

results.title: Insult to Injury
results.brief_description: A Greek factory employee injured his back at work. This program examines the problems that he encountered with doctors, Workers’ Compensation, and Unions, and their attitudes towards him.

results.title: Instrumental program
results.creator_credit: F Whitman Trecartin, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Halifax Music”.
Displays some of the talents developed by students within the Halifax School Music Department system. From choral groups to jazz bands these youngsters have fun with their music and in so doing seem to involve their audiences in that enjoyment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F Whitman Trecartin, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
